text: PET bottle. Clear golden color, white head. Strong diacetyl, small white head. Medium-bodied. Crisp hoppyness, diacetyl. Spicey Saaz. Long lingering hoppyness.

Pet bottle, 1l.
Clear golden, thin white head. 
Diacetyl, grains, malts. Sweetness, diacetyl, hops, grains. Sweet finish. Probably way better fresh from brewery :)

Golden color, creamy white head with good retention and nice lacework. Aroma with notes of sweet malts, bready. Flavor with a light bitterness, notes of noble hops, bready. Dry mouthfeel with light bitterness and straw hints.

On tap at Cafe Sara, june 28th 2016.Clear golden body, big white head. Aroma is mmalty with bread and hay, noble hops. Taste is bitter, mild earthy hops, crisp malt finish. Long bitter aftertaste. Nice.
Flaske PET 1,5L fra DjOeye. Farge klar gyldeb med hvitt skum. Lukt malt, lett fruktig duft. Smak malt, starter med litt friskhet og går over i bitterbesk.

Aroma has caramel, leaves, malts, honey and a sweetbutter signature. Appearance; near clear golden with big pearly foam, perfect for the style.
Tastes caramel, malts, leafy hops, small sweet butter notes - leading to a very nice peely soft-hoppy finish, mmzatec.
Good on palate. Good czech, fine leafy, hoppy, elegant. Id like to have it again, from a cz-tap....
[Pet from Pivotek in ČeskeBudejovice, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */sCastle]

PET-flaske 1500ml. Spandert av djoeye. Delt med ham og Rune på Nerstranda 22 Jul 16. Uklar. Lys gylden. Kritthvitt skum med litt lacing. Mye smørmalt i nesen. Smaken det samme med hint av frukt i bakgrunnen. Sånn passe.

1500ml pet bottle kindly shared by djoeye. A white tophead blanketing the glass. Hazy golden body. Distinct aroma of buttery malts added by grass. Sweet taste of buttery caramel, honey, forest, and herbal hops. Mid-sweet ending. Medium bodied. Nicely rounded mouth feel. Tasty pilsner (Summer session at Finns place in Tromsø 22.07.2016).
Frisch vom Faß in Wroclaw getrunken. Dunkelgelb im Glas. Angenehm mild im Geschmack mit leicht herben Nachtrunk.

Tap @ Budapest Hopaholic. Hazy golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty nose with notes of bread, grass, hay, vanilla and hints of toffee. Malty taste with bread, tropical fruit, hints of vanilla and a mild grassy bitterness in the finish.
Clear dark gold beer, practically no head. Light sweet, very malty, grains. Medium to full body. Pretty bitter, some banana. Nice.

Growler ftom the brewer shared @EurHop (thank you Ryan!). Pours a vivid golden color with a medium white foam. Aroma is malty, biscuits, cereals, light butter, ok. Flavour is malty, light sweet and mild bitter, not so clean. Medium body, light carbonation. A nice pils, but a bit rough and not so clean.
UPDATED: JUN 7, 2016 On tap. This is how pilsener should be like. Full saaz hops aroma, medium bitter, medium bitter finish, accurate alcohol and carbonation. Excellent.
On tap at "Beervana", Zilina. Pours is clear golden with big white head. Aroma of malts, bread, straw. Taste is bitter, grassy notes. Medium body, creamy texture, bitter finish.

F: nice white frothy, long lasting.
C: almost clear gold.
A: malty and mild hops.
T: malt and crisp grassy bitterness, lasting dry on the palate, medium body, lively carbonation, not bad but 10% from Kout na Sumave is better for me.

9/VII/15 - 1L PET bottle from a trade @ dormitory (Olomouc) - BB: n/a (2015-886)  Thanks to Motelpogo for the trade!
Clear dark blond beer, practically no head. Aroma: sweet, very malty, grains. MF: no carbon, medium to full body. Taste: pretty bitter, fruity, sweet touch, some banana, touch of vanilla, very fruity. Aftertaste: bitter hops, fruity, peaches, nice dry finish. Very nice stuff!
Clear dark gold, medium white head. Aroma - fading noble hops, some spiciness. Bitter, some malty notes, medium body. Finishes bitter yet refreshing. Excellent!
taste of very well balanced malty sweetness and hoppy bitterness with some minimal cardboard notes

4oz pour at Churchkey DC pours a hazy gold with some spitty, white head. Slightly darker gold than the 10. Nose has similar notes, chestnut honey, yeast, candy, some more estery notes. Flavor is more classic, corn, butter, straw, lemon, mild candy. Sweet finish.

Koutský 12° Světlý Leák - Bohemian Pilsener - 5%.

Orange color, slightly hazed, thick creamy white head. Fruity aroma, apricot, white grapes, peach, syrup, ginger. Resin on the hops side.
Great taste play, starts juicy sweet and finish biting bitter, with a wonderful tray of hops lingering. Finish is smooth, bitter, long, full of fops. Very tasty, excellent, one of the best svetly pilseners, stants out for its fruity overtones and great hops balance.

Tap , U Slovanske Lipy , Prague , CZ , Hazy golden color with bigger lacing creamy head , Malt,bread,butter and grassy aroma , Sweeter taste with heavier bitter finish , Medium body , Soft carbon , Very pleasant.

Tap. Semi cloudy chill haze deeper golden orange. Earthy, biscuity, doughy and savory aroma. Flavor falls a bit flatter, but nice hop earthiness and crackery malt. Body is soft, but a bit still. Im sure that this is way better closer to its home.

From tap. Pours cloudy pale yellow liquid, medium frothy head disappeared slowly. Aroma: almost no aroma, bit malty. Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, light acid, malty, nothing characteristic, Palate: average carbonation, medium body, long aftertaste but low intensity, Overall: average Pilsner, nothing remarkable.

Keg @ Churchkey. The pours hazy deep gold with a prominent creamy, thick white head. This beer nails it for looks. The nose is mellow honeycomb, beeswax. Spring bloom. Delicate flowery hop accents and hints of citrus. Lovely creamy malt base. More beeswax and pollen. Tree leaves, grass. Just a hint of lemony bitterness on the finish. Moderate body, great vitality on the palate. Overall, a wonderful pils. I could drink this all day.

1,5L PET milked fresh from the Kout teat by mowbeer, logistics by motelpogo, na zdraví dear Sirs. Pours a hazey deep yellow, mirroring a gloriously muddy bread&cereal malt and upfront yeast profile. Thick palate, almost chewy doughiness, made enjoyable by amped Saaz: tangerine zest, strawy grass, dven some light woody notes, a pervasive mineral twang. Glad I had a full Dobra Voda bottle and some peace & quiet to gauge and appreciate this unfiltered Old-World character onslaught.
Draught at Zubaty Pes. Prague, January 2014. Clear gold with white head. Some grassy hops and grain aroma, nice bitter grassy taste, full-bodied, bitter finish. The way it should be.

On tap at Churchkey - Washington, DC. I had this side by side with the 10 and was amazed at how different they were. The 10 so enamoring, with this being a little more lifeless, with a harsh, almost sour, but more like twangy harsh minerals to it. Not as well defined, a little more muddy and wandering. Less satisfying to palate in the finish. The slight more alcohol isnt met by a better body for balance. I almost want to say that this keg is a little past peak.

Bottled. Ideal appearance - light amber color with a white stable foam (which will stay with you till the end). Rich of malts, hops and some bread aroma. Very rich texture, a lot of hops in the body and in the finish, which is fine.

On tap at Churchkey. Mild hops notes in the nose, subtle and floral with a little bit of sulfur. Hazy golden amber with pillowy white lacing head. Medium body with medium-high carbonation. Starts with big malt notes and hop bitterness. Nice beany notes with carbonic bit and lagering hop floral notes. Dry bitter finish and lingering bitter after. Tasty.
Draught @ BBF13. Pours murky pale yellow with small white head. Clear aroma of hops with notes of yeast and paper. Tastes of yeast and hops, with a distinct paperlike and sourish finish. OK.
Draft at church key in DC. Light hazy gold with a minimal white head. Sweet pilsner and floral aromas. Sweet hay and malt.
Light orange color, 1 finger head. Aroma of malts, saaz hops, light apricot. Taste is light sweet, light bitter, great balance.Refreshing. Light body, oily texture, soft to average carbonation.

Thanks to Ryan for sharing! Hazed light orange pour with a white head. Big bready malt aroma. Biscuit, dough, and honey. Floral hops, some cracker, apple, and yeast. Really great malt flavor. Tons of bread, biscuit, and sweet dough. A touch of honey, some yeast, floral hops, and a crisp finish. Very subtle bitterness.
Overall great Czech brew thanks to GT2s friend. Gold and creamy head, nice lacing, smells of hops, a little fruity, but really enjoyed.

1L PET "Growler" thanks to Mowbeer! Pours a full haze golden with weaker foam. Nose is pineapple, fruit juice, fresh grass. Taste is more in the pilsner realm than the Urquell Netfiltrovany: soapy Czech hops, snappy cracker grist, oatmeal. Crisp and aggressive. Lemon peel, white pepper, sourdough biscuit. Grassy hop palate with a long finish. Solid. This one was unanimously liked by the tasting group.

On tap many times at different beer festivals,restaurants and pubs,one of my favorite Czech lagers.Pours Slightly hazy golden with a puffy white creamy head.Doughy,grassy aroma with notes of bread,buttery biscuits,butterscotch,fresh grassy hops,sweet roasted malt with a touch of citrus.
Tap at Starosloviensky pivovar, Bratislava. Hazy golden color with thick off-white head. Malty aroma with earthy notes. Malty, hoppy taste. With some earthy notes. Drinkable.
Draft. Hazy golden color, thick white head, solid lacing. Aroma of dusty rye and light spice. Taste is bitter and lightly spiced straw.

Keg at U Slovanske Lipy. Tried alongside the Regular 12. This one won. Pours a hazy yellow with a thick White head. Plenty of aromatic hops on the nose. Floral and grassy. Slighlty herbal. The Malt character is pronounced (just as in the regular 12) but theres definitly a buttery element to this one which gives it more character than an average Pilsner. Less crispness too but still a lovely bitterness to finish. Great beer.

Opn tap at Zubaty pes. Pours cloudy golden color with lasting creamy white head. Aroma is yeast, grass, slightly fruity and floral. Flavor is malty sweet at first, then balanced by nice hops bitterness. Excellent.

Draught at På Besök; Per spotted this on our smallest pub crawl in Malmö, huge thanks!Hazy golden color, with compact head. Wonderful delicate aroma of malt, with a cereal and straws Character, and a soft fruity edge. The mouthfeel is smooth; very good malt flavor, with a light crispy side, some caramel too, and a light grassy presence; the bitterness is quite bold, not very aromatic. It has some light residual sweetness and a pleasant fruity touch.I have to get back here soon.

U Slovanské lípy, Prága. Opálos, mély arany színű pilzeni, tetején egészen komoly tömör fehér habbal, mely ráadásul igen kitartó is. Illata malátás-gabonás, füvesen komlós és gyümölcsösen élesztős, kellemes. Íze hasonló, erőteljes malátás alapízzel indít, van benne egy kis gyümölcsösség és vajasság is, majd következik a füves komló száraz, finoman kesernyés mérvadó íze, valamint a szárazságot erősítendő kevés élesztő. Közepesen testes, nagyon könnyen fogyasztható ízgazdag pilzeni. A már kipróbált, de a helyszínen újrakóstolt szűrt változat (számomra) meglepő módon egy fokkal jobb, mint ez a szűretlen verzió, ami a legtöbb sörnél igen ritka. Ettől függetlenül mindkettő remek, élvezetes pilzeni.

(Draught at U Slovanske Lipy, Prague, 30 July 2011) Hazy golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty nose with notes of bread, grass, hay, vanilla and hints of toffee. Malty taste with bread, tropical fruit, hints of vanilla and a mild grassy bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a touch of malt sweetness. Quite nice.

Tap @ U Slovanské lípy, Prague.Pours hazy tan with a small white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, grassy hops, lemon. Taste is bready malt, caramel, lemon floral and grassy hops, big taste for a beer of this ABV. Smooth full body, soft carbonation, high drinkabillity. 300711
tap at slovanske lipy.    doughy toasted cereal.  a touch vegetal. dry, earthy, wet swamp.  rustic grass.  clean.  well made.

My first ever from Kout, on tap at U Slovanské Lípy, Prague. Right from the tap it looks hazy golden with a big creamy white head, nice lacings. Aroma is quite strong grassy and citrussy hops. Taste is impressing, mellow and moderate sweet malts, caramel, with those good hops playing in my mouth thanks to the carbonation. This is my definition of a moreish beer.

(draught 0,5l)
Yeast, light floral aroma. Hazy golden color. Huge all time white head. Medium sweet, light bitter. Lively. Medium body. Creamy, light sticky texture. Bitter, astringent, dry finish. Very drinkable. One of the best.

Dull tan with a light haze.  Inch of head.  The aroma shows yeast and caramel.  This has an earthy, caramelly, yeasty character, not as bright and tasty as the 10.  Ok, though, just not exciting or innovative.

Draught, at U Slovanské Lípy, Prague. Dark orangish gold with a low, fine head. Big hoppy aroma, with grass, pine, a bit of citrus, and lovely pils malts. Flavor of citrus, grass, biscuity. Lovely, fragrant hops ride above soft, delicate malts. Slightly estery, too, with just a hint of banana. A wonderful, hoppy pilsner, one of the best ever!
Draught. Hazy dark golden colour. Small stable white head. High bitterness, quite rough and almost unpleasant. Good aromatic hop flavour.

(draught, at U Slovanské Lípy, Prague) hazy golden colour with a tall white head. aroma of spicy, perfumed floral hops and pale malts. flavour is heaploads of herbal hops, with light fruity pine notes and honey. medium body and carbonation with a bold bitter finish.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2009 tap U Slovanské lípy, Prague 3 ikov, yeast and cereal aroma, hazy, white rocky foam, medium bitter, light sweet, lively, fizzy, long finish, medium body...vetry good
re rate: full body
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text:
Bottle 50 cl. Pours a hazy golden with a gigantic and frothy white head. Fresh malts, flowers and a little yeastiness in the nose. Fairly light body, a little watery actually yet solidly malty with floral accents and a whiff of yeast. The finish is dry with a light bitterness. 260608

On tap. Hazy golden with a creamy, white head leaving broad curtains of lacework. Aroma of malt and a little butter. Medium body, swetish malt and again distinct butter notes. Short, dry finish. Pity about the butter. 6/3/5/3/11=2.8 260608
Clear golden with tiny white head. Sweet yeasty aroma with caramel and malty notes. Sweet fruity flavor with caramel and mild hoppy notes.

(6/26/08) Draught at Koutland in Plzen. Hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma of yeast, and some nice juicy grassy hoppiness. Sweetish flavor with malt, butterscotch,  hints of biscuits and nice hoppy bitterness in the finish. Medium-bodied with quite a lot of carbonation. Very fresh with good hoppiness.

Draught at Koutland in Plzen. Unclear golden - white head. Grainy, egg, white bread, light flowery, nice malty, grains, vitamins. More or less like the unfiltrated version, but a bit ekstra butter/diacetyl, sourness and not as good.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2009 Handbottled. Thanks ChristianSheffel. Pours hazy/slight unclear yellow with a small white head. Aroma is very grassy & fresh hayish. Crisp & enjoyable. A bit mouldy with notes of sweet buiscuit/butter before a bitter end. Óne of the best pils ive had!

Rerating Nov. 09. Had this at U Slovanske Lipy, Prague. Citrus, buiscuit, grass, floral and yeasty. Soo fresh and lovely. 3,6 - 3,9
On tap @ Koutland, Plzen. Hazy and kinda orange in colour with a medium sized head. Quite nice and well balanced - notes of bread, grain and also a bit floral.

[on tap at Koutland in Plzen]
Sweet 2-row aroma with citrus and peack and watermelon sorbet notes along with some noble hops.  Hazy, dark yellow under a white sheet that doesn’t last too long.  Quite a bit of diacetyl in the flavour.  Sweet with almost some corn together with the malt.  Some rancidy and bitter hops that become more perceptible after the palate adjusts to the sweetness.  Medium body, moderate carbonation, lingering bitterness.
Tap @ Koutland, Plzen. Pour muddy orange with a pure white head. Aroma is very malty sweet with buttery notes . Flavour is also malty sweet with butterscotch and again notes of butter.

Bottle, thanks a lot Harrisoni! Fruity yeast and nice fresh grassy and citric hop note.  Cloudy golden, tanned creamy layer. Very good fruity start, mainly orangepeel, a hint butterscotch which actually fits well in, good grassy hopprofile in the finish, all perfectly balanced. Chewy grain bottom, sparkly mouthfeel. Truly great.

Draught at Koutland, Plzen.
Light hazy yellow coloured, small white head, light bready butterscotch nose. Light malty, fresh hoppy and too strong butterscotch taste for rate higher than 3.1.

(Draught) Pours light hazy golden. The aroma is light to medium sweet with some buttery notes. Floral hops and bread/cookie-like malt. Bit yeasty. The flavour is of grassy hops, bread and cookie-like malt. Some buttery notes are present in the flavour as well. The mouthfeel is light creamy, light soft and bit crisp with a dry finish. Medium bodied.

Draught at Koutland, Plzen. Hazed gold with off white head. I found the unfiltered version to have a much greater hoppy character with a real lime like character. Dry and herbal, I noted parsley but it was getting late, it finished quite bitter. Good stuff.

Draught. Hazy golden colour with mediumsized white creamy head, leaves some lace. Aroma is yeast, some malts, sweet berries, earth and rather diacetylic. Flavour is quite much the same, and aftertaste leaves a grassy diacetyl. 7 3 7 3 14
Bottled. Colour is not as hazy as the draught one, no lace. More berries and mild yeasty notes as well as sweet vegetably notes in aroma. Flavour has lots of grass, some mild yeast as well as mild grassy hops. 8 3 8 3 16.

On tap at Koutland, Plzen.  Grassy diacetyl.  Real shame.  Grassy hop like the filtered version, bit sweet and full in mouth, but the diacetyl kills it. Re-rate Bottle bought from the bar and drunk in my hotel room.  A rather good unfiltered 12 degree beer with plenty of character and hop.  Having had a number of these this weekend, this isn’t bad, in fact it’s just about the best except Pilsner Urquell.

Draught at Koutland, Plzen.  
Hazy yellow colour. Fresh, hoppy aroma with quite a lot of butterscotch, not too much since the maltiness is still sensed. Good malty flavour with grassy hops. 

The sampling from bottle felt much fresher and hoppier, with much less butterscotch, if any at all.

From tap at Koutland. Pours hazy yellow to orange wih a alacing white head. Mild butterish and yeasty aroma. Flavour is smooth caramel malty and light cornish. Holds a medium sweet to medium dry flavoured finish.

Hazy golden with a perfect, long lasting white head. Lots of clean bready malt dominates the aroma, but there is a little too much butterscotch for my taste. Rich malty flavour, full body and again, just a little too much diacetyl.
UPDATED: JUL 8, 2008 Tap at koutland ... Golden yellow  slight haze ... light hop nose ... light fruity but over fizzy.

Tap at koutland, it had some problems(3.5). However we managed to buy some bottles and i felt it was soo good that i took two home however ended up drinking them in the street. Alround rating: Buttery grainy pale malts, lemon biscuits, herbal hop. In the bottle the balance is superiour.

Draught at Koutland (3 consecutive nights!)  Hazy golden, small head. Buttery nose with lots of grass. Freshly hoppy with hay and orange. Light-medium bodied with a crisp, vital malt profile, Long bitter finish. A superb drinking beer!

Draft. An unclear golden beer with a huge off-white head. The aroma is sweet malty with notes of hops as well as hints of butter. The flavor is sweet malty with light notes of both diacethyl and butter, leading to a dry bitter finish [5/2/5/3/9=2.4]Bottled - tapped from the tank at the brewery the day prior to sampling. A hazy golden beer with a lazing white head. The aroma is sweet malty with notes of hops, straw, and freshly cut hay. The flavor is sweet with strong notes of straw and medium notes of malt, leading to a dry bitter finish. The rating is for this version.On day zero of RBESG there was a problem with the draft version of this - glad that there was a supply of a bottled version to give the beer some recognition.
UPDATED: JUL 15, 2008 Draught at Koutland, Plzen, Czech Republic. Deep hazy golden with medium white head. Fresh grassy and floral hop aroma on a solid bready malt base. Long bitter finish.

At the Koutland in Plzen, supplied by omhper (thanks a lot!) Poured a murky orange colour with a medium sized head. A pleasant flowery nose with a dry yeasty yoghurtiness. The taste is balanced between a flowery maltiness and yoghurty yeastiness.  A very, very good beer and Im so glad Ive tried it.

Draft in Zly Kasy, Prague.
Grainy, chewy, malty. Dark gold.
Caramel, then a lovely bitter twist in the tail. 
Great stuff.

Draft at Koutland in Plzen.  Cloudy orange/yellow colored body (like hefeweizen) with a white head.  Nose of yeast wheat, full, tart lemon and citrus throughout.  Tastes like a hefeweizen at times, a little too much, only lighter.  A little spritzy, etc, on the palate, but muddled by the yeast, thats easy to see.  Nothing special, but tasty enough.

I wish I had taken a picture of this beer.  I mean I took one of about every other one that I had on this trip but again, this was the end of the drinking day for me and I was feeling no pain.  My notes are pretty abrupt with this one. Even and fruity well balanced with some bready yeastyness that is calming.  Semi-hazy. I liked the normal 12 degree and went back to it after fiishing this.  Others dove in to the baltic porter but I was overloaded at this point and ready for an extended nap.  A fine beer nonetheless, and I am fortunate to have had it.

Back from a Czech Republic pub-crawl this is part of my express ratings for the typical Světlý 11°- (Czech light Pils), Světlý 12°+ (Czech Pils), Polotmavý (Czech Amber Lagers) and Tmavý (Czech Black Lagers).  Non-typical beers will receive personalized descriptions after the express ratings.-------- />
How: Tap at Koutland, Pilsen, Czech Republic
The look: Partly cloudy golden body with a large white head
To me a typical Czech Světlý 12° and above is: Well malted body with plenty of biscuits and cereals.  Sweetness level is in the light-medium range with some honey flavours and a light caramel presence (3/4 honey, 1/4 caramel).  Fruity flavour limited to a light citrus flavour.  Medium carbonation.  Finish is dry and moderately bitter with a light citric touch.  After-taste of dry grassy/herbal hops with a light dry spiciness character.
This one: As above but with a dusty/floury.  You can feel the extraordinary regular Koutský 12° Světlý Leák in there but this dusty/floury yeast addition brings it down a notch.

En fût. Pinte dégustée chez Koutland (Plzen, Rép. Tchèque). Arôme: Odeur dagrume et de cérérale. Apparence: La couleur est blonde légèrement orangée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun large col mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréale  et dhoublon avec une pointe fruitée. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de céréale en arrière goût. (Rating #1550)

My Bottom Line:
Bready cereals are laden with yeast throughout this fruity and lightly bitter Světlý Leák. The yeast might be a tad too important here, but I wouldnt complain if the filtered 12° werent so mesmerizing.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A full head of foam decorates the hazy orangey blond.
-The fruitiness is pretty much the same as the filtered 12°s in its orangey, tangerine leanings.
-A subtle wooden hop finish helps drinkablity.
-Flavors are not as clearly defined as this beers unfiltered version, but its body, zestiness and quenching factor are all as enjoyable.

On tap at Koutland, Plzen.

Draught at Koutland, Pilsen. Hazy golden coloured. This has all of the nice aromas and flavours as the filtered version, but with a fruity and slightly yeasty touch. The lack of filtration also makes it slightly softer. A fantastic beer, but the cleaner filtered version is even better.

Draught, Koutland/Plzen.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly lasting.
Body is hazy light amber.

Aroma is moderately malty (toasted bread/grain), lightly yeasty (dough), lightly to moderately hoppy (flowers, herbs, orange), with a note of honey.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation.

Pretty similar to the filtered, just with a touch more yeast character and sourness.  Thankfully that dullish sour tang isnt as marked in this beer as it was in many other cases, but it does make it a bit less enjoyable for my tastes. Still, a terrific beer.

Ze sudu v Koutlandu: Golden, creamy, lacing head, aromatic - oaky-hoppy- nose, mixed with some yeasty fruitiness, moderate bitter-sweet flavour, medium-bodied, soft MF, slightly lingering, bitter-oaky finish with traces of sweet pale malt. Very good B.P., but not so impressive as the filtered version............

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2007 Tap at Koutland. Fantastic head on this one - notes say "looks like a kvasnicovy" strangely enough. The same resiny hop aroma as in all the pale Kout beers but accompanied by more peachy/apricoty malt in this one. Solid malt flavour with excellent fruitiness and hop flavour. Bitterness is relatively low, and its relatively light on the sulfury yeast stuff for a kvasnicovy. Very nice beer, but this is one of the few kvasnicovys in the CR which I liked less than the filtered version, but I guess thats because the filtered 12% is so freaking good.

Angenehm würziger, samtig karamelliger und leicht herber Geruch. Sehr gut ausgeglichener, ansprechend würziger und herb motivierter Geschmack. Sanft karamellige Art, die in die unheimlich gute Komposition wirklich exakt reinpasst. Deutlich würzigerer Mittelteil mit leicht süsslichem Inferno. Angenehm herber und langanhaltender Geschmack im Abgang. Genial!

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2008 First rating(Draught at Koutland, Plzen. Thanks motelpogo for the tip!) Shady golden color, white head. Grassy hoppy scent. Nice hoppy taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness.7/4/7/3/15=3.6Rerate(Draught in Plzen)On June 26, 2008Cloudy orange color, white head. Fruity and yeasty scent, some aprictos. Sweet, fruity, hoppy, butterscotch taste. Medium mouthfeel and medium bitterness.8/4/8/3/15=3.8(On bottle, Plzn)June 26, 2008Shady yellow color, fluffy white head. Fresh fruity scent. Sweet fruity taste. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness.8/4/8/4/17=4.1

Beautiful slightly hazy golden body, creamy white head, laces; Super, super balanced super elegant nose, it has perfect noble hop aromas, pleasant soft malt and spicy yeast aromas in a near perfect combination; Very fresh body with a fresh big carbonation, soft texture, great and elegant combination of bitter, sweet and yeasty dry part, super; Super complex balanced long finish, again a perfect combination of yeast, malt and hop aromas . What an amazing and fantastic beer.

on tap at koutland. for quite a while i couldnt get too excited about this beer which was quite odd considering how obsessed ive become with kvasnicovy beers and with kout beers. anyways, i think it must have improved appreciably. the first few kegs of this had a decent saaz nose but quite an overwhelming sourdough character which dulled the juicy bitterness of the filtered 12ká. anzways, a balance seems to have been found and this is ripe and pungent with traces of pineapple, lemon zest and a big saaz kick that, as with the other kout beers, reminds me just how little saaz character a lot of czech beers have these days.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2008 Growler. [thank you motelpogo]. Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow with quite a sparkle to it. Small creamy off white head. Fruity hoppy aroma combined with a heavy dose of the standard Saazer. Flavour though is quite citric sour with a sweet malty centre and a definite dryness to the end. a very different bohemian Pilsner. 7/4/7/3/12
Had it on tap @ Koutland at RBESG08.
Hazy golden with a completely white, creamy head. Okay duration. Aroma has some butterscotch and crisp maltiness with pleasant grassy hops. Super mouthfeel, lightly creamy and grainy. Flavour is a bit of a let-down, softly malty and weakly hopped. The filtered is much better. 7/5/7/3/12

Slightly eggy aroma which fades an shows some apricoty fruit and grassy hop notes. Palate is dry and quite bitter. The apricot comes through again in the fruit, dry apricot. Very nice, and was surprised that i prefered the filtered to this, the unfiltered.
